name: tamped mud
description: A monotonous expanse of compacted, semi-solidified mud, trampled into the vague semblance of a traversable pathway through the urgings of countless ambulatory motions: human, the local fauna, or otherwise.

name: quagmire
description: Rising to the ankle  and even boot-hight, this gelatinous sediment of foulness, rancid ooze, and stagnant water demands careful footing from the would-be hiker, passer, or runner.  You would dearly rather not think too deeply about the occasional lumps you spy wriggling through the morass.

name: cobblestone
description: A section of roughly paved ground inlayed with square-cut stones, bound together by mortar, and set in sand.  More practical than pretty, you’re a long way away from the properly paved streets of the mainland’s cities.
